business.headline: More trouble for Anil Ambani's Reliance Group as government launches probeMore trouble for Anil Ambani's Reliance Group, Corporate Affairs ministry launches probe into fund diversion

Lenskart IPO GMP falls sharply before listing. Is it heading for a weak debut?Lenskart's IPO, which opened for subscription on October 31 and closed on November 4, received an overall subscription of 28.27 times, as per exchange data.
8th Pay Commission: 5 things you need to knowThe 8th Pay Commission sets up a major revision in salaries and pensions. Here are key things you need to know.

Porter layoffs: 300 employees impacted as startup trims workforce, says reportThe company confirmed the layoffs on Tuesday, saying the move was part of a broader effort to make the organisation more efficient and financially resilient.

Explained: What rising demand for gold says about global economy As inflation worries persist and geopolitical risks grow, is the world turning to gold because economies are strengthening or because everyone is preparing for tougher financial times ahead?

Man calls Zerodha's Rs 5 crore withdrawal limit scam. Expert explains why it's notZerodha, India's largest retail brokerage platform, was blocking an investor's fund withdrawal. He called the incident a "scam" and accused the company of using his money for free.

Home prices surge up to 19% in top cities. Why buying is getting tougherFresh data from PropTiger shows property prices jumping 7% to 19% in the July to September quarter. Read to know the factors driving the surge in prices.

Can gold prices climb past Rs 1,25,000 again? Here's all you need to knowGlobal politics, central bank moves and investor nerves are all tightening the screws. Will gold finally get the spark it needs to push past the Rs 1.25 lakh mark?

Finance Buddha IPO: Anchor book oversubscribed before issue opening on November 6The IPO consists entirely of a fresh issue of 50.48 lakh shares in the price band of Rs 140 to Rs 142 per share. The issue opens for subscription on November 6 and closes on November 10.

Paytm delivers Rs 211 crore profit in Q2FY26, driven by AI-Led efficiency and cost disciplineOperating revenue grew 24% year-on-year to Rs 2,061 crore, led by growth in subscription merchants, higher Gross Merchandise Value (GMV), and continued expansion in financial services.

Unconditional cash transfers to women increasing fiscal pressure on states: ReportThe report notes that the number of states implementing UCT schemes for women has increased sharply from just two in 2022–23 to twelve in 2025–26.

Nvidia joins India Deep Tech Alliance as group secures $850 million boostThe alliance, launched in September 2025 with an initial commitment of $1 billion, aims to close the funding gap faced by research-driven startups in India.

China suspends 24% tariff on US goods for a year, keeps 10% levyThe announcement comes shortly after last week's meeting between Chinese President Xi Jinping and US President Donald Trump, which marked a step towards easing trade tensions between the world's two largest economies.

Tougher renewable norms may cloud India's clean energy growth: ReportThe proposed regulations, introduced by the Central Electricity Regulatory Commission (CERC) in September 2025, aim to make renewable power suppliers more accountable for maintaining grid discipline.

Guru Nanak Jayanti holiday: Is stock market open or closed for trading today?Apart from the scheduled holidays, the stock market also remains closed on all Saturdays and Sundays as part of the regular weekend schedule.

Nobody bigger than institution: Mehli Mistry in parting note to Tata Trust trusteesIn a letter addressed to all trustees, including Chairman Noel Tata, Mistry wrote that his loyalty to Ratan N Tata's vision comes with a duty to keep the Tata Trusts free from controversy. He noted that any escalation of internal matters could cause lasting damage to the organisation's reputation.

Reliance Group clarifies: ED-attached assets belong to Rcom, business unaffectedReliance Group said that the action has no impact on the business operations of Reliance Infrastructure and Reliance Power.

Is India's tax system fueling the IPO rush? Zerodha's Nithin Kamath thinks soIndia's booming startup economy may be running on a system that rewards valuation over value, and growth over resilience, says Nithin Kamath.

Hinduja Group Chairman Gopichand P Hinduja dies at London hospitalGopichand P Hinduja, who represented the second generation of the influential business family, took charge of the multinational Hinduja Group in May 2023, following the death of his elder brother, Srichand P Hinduja.
Sensex ends 519 points lower, Nifty below 25,600; Eternal down 3%The S&P BSE Sensex lost 519.34 points to close at 83,459.15, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 165.70 points to end at 25,597.65.

entertainment.headline: Inspection Bungalow trailer: Zee5 series promises a chilling yet heartwarming ride Zee5 has announced a new Malayalam web series, 'Inspection Bungalow', described as a blend of horror and comedy, with its premiere scheduled for November 14.

Zohran Mamdani's Dhoom Machale moment a big high for India's soft power: Pritam Zohran Mamdani's historic win as New York City's mayor was celebrated with the iconic 'Dhoom Machale' track. Composer Pritam Chakraborty called the moment a proud reflection of India's growing cultural footprint.

Namit Das marks Zohran Mamdani's mayoral win with heartwarming 2017 throwback pics Namit Das shared throwback photos along with a note to celebrate Zohran Mamdani's mayoral win. He became New York City's youngest and first Muslim mayor.

Daniel Day-Lewis slams Brian Cox for dragging him into method acting debate Daniel Day-Lewis has responded to Brian Cox's criticism of Jeremy Strong's method acting. The exchange sheds light on the pressures and controversies surrounding intense acting techniques.

Harshvardhan Rane just took over this franchise from John Abraham. Read here Basking in the success of 'Ek Deewane Ki Deewaniyat', actor Harshvardhan Rane has announced his next film. He will be taking over a popular franchise from actor John Abraham.

Prime Video, Sony LIV, ZEE5: Maxton Hall S2, Maharani S4 and more This week's OTT lineup brings a mix of emotions and genres - from the political drama 'Maharani 4' and the romantic youth series 'Maxton Hall 2' to the heartwarming family dramedy 'Thode Door Thode Paas'. With new releases on Prime Video, Sony LIV, and ZEE5, there's something fresh for every kind of viewer.

Shabana Azmi praises Zohran Mamdani's win, says Trump spread negative publicity Zohran Mamdani has made history as New York City's youngest and first Muslim mayor, winning a closely contested election at just 34. Shabana Azmi hailed his message of social justice and inclusivity in a note.

Agatha Christie's Seven Dials on Netflix. When does the murder mystery premiere? Streaming platform Netflix has revealed new details and a trailer for its forthcoming adaptation of Agatha Christie's Seven Dials, featuring Mia McKenna-Bruce, Helena Bonham Carter, and Martin Freeman.

AR Rahman launches Rooh-e-Noor, an all-women band celebrating Indian music AR Rahman introduces Rooh-e-Noor, a six-member all-women ensemble led by Khatija Rahman on Wednesday. The ensemble's world premiere is scheduled for November 21 this year at the Tanweer Festival in Sharjah.

Netflix this week: Frankenstein, Baramulla, Ek Chatur Naar and more Netflix's lineup this week offers a mix of global releases, from Guillermo del Toro's gothic 'Frankenstein' to the Indian horror thriller 'Baramulla'. With genres spanning horror, drama, and comedy, there's something new for every kind of viewer to stream.

Tim Robinson's The Chair Company becomes HBO's biggest comedy hit in 5 years Tim Robinson's new HBO comedy, 'The Chair Company', has become an instant hit, drawing 1.4 million viewers in just three days. It also secured a top spot on HBO Max charts both in the US and internationally.

Nora Fatehi shares first poster of US single What Do I Know with Shenseea Nora Fatehi and Shenseea unveiled the poster for their new international single releasing November 7, 2025. The collaboration highlights female empowerment and marks Nora's US music debut.

Chikiri in Ram Charan's Peddi: AR Rahman, Buchi Babu decode meaning of the single Ahead of the release of Ram Charan's much-awaited film Peddi, music composer AR Rahman and director Buchi Babu Sana offered fans a delightful sneak peek into the film's first single, Chikiri.

Khushi Kapoor rings in 25th birthday with pink-themed midnight bash. See pics Actor Khushi Kapoor welcomed her 25th birthday with a cosy midnight gathering. The celebration was attended by her closest friends and family, including Shanaya.

Farrhana Bhatt's family sues Amaal Mallik's aunt for calling her a terrorist Farrhana Bhatt's team has issued a legal notice to Roshan Garry Bhinder, the Fifafooz YouTube channel, and YouTube India in response to allegedly defamatory content. The Kashmiri actor and peace activist, currently participating in 'Bigg Boss 19', seeks immediate action following statements made in a recent YouTube interview.

For 14 months, I didn't know if he was alive: Celina Jaitly on brother's abduction Celina Jaitly has approached the Delhi High Court after her brother, Major (Retd) Vikrant Vikram Jaitly, was abducted in Dubai and later moved to a detention centre. The actor shared her 14-month ordeal, revealing she had no contact with him for eight months.

Kajol went to Govinda's home to invite him for Two Much, says Twinkle Khanna During a recent interview, Twinkle Khanna revealed the struggle behind inviting Govind to their talk show 'Two Much With Kajol and Twinkle'. The show features a star-studded guest list and streams on Prime Video.

Ajith admits putting wife Shalini through tough times: I'm not easy to live with Actor Ajith Kumar opens up about his journey in the film industry, the impact of undergoing 29 surgeries, and the vital support provided by his wife Shalini amid challenges in acting and racing.

Kiss OTT release: When and where to watch Kavin, Preethi Asrani's rom-com The fantasy romantic comedy 'Kiss', featuring Kavin and Preethi Asrani, will become available for streaming on OTT. The film, directed by Sathish Krishnan, explores themes of love and fate and follows the journey of a musician with a unique ability.

general news.headline: Seema, Sweety, who? Rahul Gandhi claims Brazil model 'voted' 22 times in HaryanaA Brazilian model's photograph allegedly appearing 22 times on the Haryana poll rolls became the centrepiece of Rahul Gandhi's explosive voter fraud charge against the BJP and the Election Commission.

How three Muslims with Indian roots left Trump with a black eyeThree Muslim Democrats of Indian origin, Zohran Mamdani, Aftab Pureval, and Ghazala Hashmi, have handed US President Donald Trump his first political setback within months of him becoming the President.

Rishabh Pant back as BCCI announces squad for two-Test series vs South AfricaRishabh Pant has made his return to the Indian Test squad as BCCI announced the 15-member side for the upcoming series against South Africa.

Is Rahul Gandhi supporting SIR or opposing it? Election Commission hits backIn an intensified attack against the poll body and the BJP on the eve of the Bihar Assembly polls, Rahul Gandhi claimed 
that a plan was put in place to subvert Congress's victory in the 2024 Haryana state elections.  He alleged theft of 25 lakh votes in Haryana, including 5.21 lakh duplicate voters, 93,174 invalid voters and 19.26 lakh bulk voters.

Video: Estranged Tej Pratap, Tejashwi cross paths but not words in chance run-inTej Pratap Yadav, the elder son of Lalu Prasad, was in the middle of an interview with Samdish Bhatia when he ran into Tejashwi. The two estranged brothers crossed paths but not words during the chance encounter.
More trouble for Anil Ambani's Reliance Group as government launches probeMore trouble for Anil Ambani's Reliance Group, Corporate Affairs ministry launches probe into fund diversion

Mira Nair beams with pride as son Zohran Mamdani becomes New York's youngest mayorZohran Mamdani made history by becoming the youngest and first Muslim mayor of New York City, defeating Andrew Cuomo and Curtis Sliwa. His win is being celebrated by family and supporters, especially his mother, filmmaker Mira Nair.

David Beckham is now Sir David Beckham: Football great knighted by King CharlesDavid Beckham has been formally knighted for his services to football and British society. The former England captain received the honour from King Charles III during a ceremony held at Windsor Castle in Berkshire on Tuesday.

How Mamdani is linked to Adani, AmbaniThough New York City mayor-elect Zohran Mamdani champions socialist politics in New York, his surname traces back to the same Gujarati roots as that of corporates Mukesh Ambani and Gautam Adani. Across the seas and centuries, these family names tell a story of commerce, migration and shared histories.

Vreels: A Game-Changing Platform Pushing Social Media Beyond TikTok and InstagramVreels isn't just about sharing, it's about connecting meaningfully. Through built-in chat, voice, and video call features, users can communicate without leaving the app.

Man rams car into pedestrians in France, shouts 'Allahu Akbar' after arrestA 35-year-old man rammed his car into pedestrians in France on Wednesday, injuring nine people. He has been taken into police custody.

Brazilian photographer's mystery model who's Saraswati, Sweety, Seema in HaryanaCongress leader Rahul Gandhi alleged electoral fraud in Haryana, showing the image of a woman featuring on 22 voter cards in Haryana. That photo turns out to be of a model photographed by Brazilian photographer Matheus Ferrero. Though the model's identity remains a mystery, her photo has long been circulated on stock image platforms and by news portals.

Mumbai housing society pulls out all stops for coach Amol Muzumdar's homecomingIndia's World Cup-winning women's team coach Amol Muzumdar received an emotional homecoming in Vile Parle, where women from his neighbourhood lined up with raised bats to form a guard of honour as he returned after guiding India to their first ODI World Cup title.

WPL 2026 Retention Live Updates: Meg Lanning set to be released by Delhi CapitalsWPL 2026 Retention Live Updates: The six teams in the Women's Premier League are set to announce their retentions and releases for the upcoming edition of the tournament. The mega auction is set for November 27 in New Delhi. The Mumbai Indians are the defending champions.

Haq review: Yami-Emraan's film a mature take on faith, law and legacy of Shah BanoRelease Date:Fri Nov 07, 2025Haq movie review: 'Haq' is a powerful film inspired by the Shah Bano case, exploring faith and law. It highlights the struggle for women's dignity amidst societal and religious challenges.

Delhi gasps, Beijing breathes: Can China teach India how to clean up smog?In this episode of Statecraft, Geeta Mohan examines why Delhi remains one of the world's most polluted cities while Beijing has drastically improved its air quality over the past decade.

Radha Yadav's father steals the show on social media, proudly lifts Women's World CupA photo of Radha Yadav's father lifting the Women's ODI World Cup trophy during India's on-field celebrations has gone viral, beautifully capturing the pride and joy of the families behind the team's historic maiden world title.

26/11: Did Pak president's nuclear no-first-use offer trigger ISI to attack India?Former adviser of Pakistan president Asif Ali Zardari says the Mumbai 26/11 attacks were a response to his offer of a 'no first use' (of nuclear weapons) to India. But the chronology of facts suggests the attacks would have happened regardless of what he said.

Zohran Mamdani's 'four words for Trump' in electric victory speechZohran Mamdani, who once described himself as Trump's 'worst nightmare', reminded the US President that the city that 'gave rise to him' could also defeat him.

Cadet no. 1: The story of India's first woman to join the Indian ArmyIn 1992, Major Priya Jhingan became the first woman officer in the Indian Army's non-medical branch. Her pioneering role opened doors for many women, transforming the army's approach to female officers.

Why Bangladesh did a U-turn on hate preacher Zakir Naik's visitThe Muhammad Yunus government had approved Zakir Naik's visit from November 28 in a major policy shift after the radical preacher was banned by the previous Sheikh Hasina regime.

Father breaks down as son becomes Chartered Accountant, emotional video goes viralA father's tearful reaction as he embraced his son while celebrating his success in clearing the CA exam went viral, with social media users congratulating the pair in the comments section.

sports.headline: No Rohit Sharma, Virat Kohli in India A squad for South Africa one-dayers India A have named Tilak Varma as captain for the upcoming one-day series against South Africa A. Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma were not considered for the series, which will help the white-ball specialists prepare for the three-match ODI series against South Africa in November-December.

Rishabh Pant back as BCCI announces squad for two-Test series vs South Africa Rishabh Pant has made his return to the Indian Test squad as BCCI announced the 15-member side for the upcoming series against South Africa.

No Chhetri as India reveal probables list for Asian Cup qualifier vs Bangladesh India have decided to drop Sunil Chhetri from the probables list for the AFC Asian Cup qualifier against Bangladesh. Chhetri came back to the Indian team in March this year, reversing his retirement call from last year.

Nothing like Yograj Singh: Yuvraj dismisses comparisons to father's coaching style Yuvraj Singh says his coaching style is built on empathy and understanding, not the strict discipline he grew up with under his father, Yograj Singh. He admitted that his mentorship of Abhishek Sharma and Shubman Gill has been shaped by patience, trust and years of shared hard work.

Champions in Delhi: PM Modi to honour India's World Cup-winning women's cricket team This special report focuses on the Indian women's cricket team, led by Harmanpreet Kaur, being felicitated by Prime Minister Narendra Modi in New Delhi. This follows their historic maiden ICC Women's Cricket World Cup victory in 2025 against South Africa. The Prime Minister stated that 'this win is going to inspire millions of youth'. The felicitation mirrors the honour given to the men's team after their T20 World Cup win in 2024, highlighting the significance of this achievement. The team's journey to the top has been a long one, marked by near misses in the World Cup finals of 2005 and 2017. This victory is seen as a revolution for women's cricket in India, with players like Smriti Mandhana, Deepti Sharma, and Shafali Verma becoming inspirations for a new generation.

What's holding Shubman Gill back in Australia T20Is? Ex-pacer discusses India vs Australia, 4th T20I: Former pacer Zaheer Khan urged vice-captain Shubman Gill to play with freedom and trust his natural instincts. Gill has endured a lean run since his return to the T20I side in the Asia Cup.

Cristiano Ronaldo hints he will retire soon to spend time with family Cristiano Ronaldo reveals he will retire soon, shares personal goals and thoughts on Manchester United's recent decline. The football icon discusses preparations for life after football.

George Bailey rejects Steve Waugh's concerns over Australia's ageing Test lineup Selectors for Australia have reaffirmed their faith in the core of seasoned players for the Ashes squad, brushing aside criticism from ex-captain Steve Waugh. The move reignites discussions about succession, with most squad members past their 30th birthday.

WPL 2026 Retention Live Updates: Meg Lanning set to be released by Delhi Capitals WPL 2026 Retention Live Updates: The six teams in the Women's Premier League are set to announce their retentions and releases for the upcoming edition of the tournament. The mega auction is set for November 27 in New Delhi. The Mumbai Indians are the defending champions.

Bangladesh women's captain blasts ex-teammate for rumours over beating juniors Bangladesh captain Nigar Sultana Joty has strongly denied former teammate Jahanara Alam's allegations of misconduct, calling them baseless and driven by personal grudges. The BCB also backed Joty, labelling Jahanara's claims malicious and aimed at undermining team unity.

1st T20I: West Indies survive Santner scare to seal thriller, take 1-0 lead West Indies overcame a late onslaught from skipper Mitchell Santner to edge past New Zealand in the T20I series opener. Santner's unbeaten 55 off 28 balls nearly powered the hosts to an extraordinary comeback win.

With T20 World Cup dream in mind, Matthew Short ready to move down the orderMatthew Short said that he is ready to bat down the order for Australia in a bid to make it to the squad for the T20 World Cup 2026. Short has been batting at No.7 during the ongoing series against India.

Rohit Sharma, Virat Kohli unlikely to play in South Africa A one-day series: ReportDespite speculation that Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli might use the India A games to stay match-ready, the senior duo is now expected to skip the South Africa A one-dayers beginning November 13.

Once a king, always a king: Yuvraj, Kuldeep lead wishes for Virat Kohli's birthdayVirat Kohli's 37th birthday saw heartfelt wishes pour in from teammates, former players and family, with Yuvraj Singh leading the tributes, celebrating Kohli's passion, legacy and unmatched impact on Indian cricket.

Pakistan media claims Haris Rauf was handed demerit points without prior noticePakistan fast bowler Haris Rauf was suspended for two matches for breaching the ICC Code of Conduct twice during the Asia Cup. A report in the Pakistan media claimed that the pacer was handed demerit points without prior notice.

India's predicted playing XI for 4th T20I vs Australia: Will Sanju Samson return?India vs Australia 4th T20I, Predicted XI: Sanju Samson is likely to remain on the bench as India are expected to give Jitesh Sharma another opportunity in the fourth T20I of the five-match series against Australia.

Champions India likely to meet President Droupadi Murmu on Nov 6The World Cup-winning Indian women's cricket team is likely to meet President Droupadi Murmu in New Delhi on November 6. The Harmanpreet Kaur-led side arrived in the national capital on Tuesday evening ahead of their interaction with the Prime Minister.

Cristiano Ronaldo included in Al-Nassr squad for FC Goa clash in Riyadh: ReportCristiano Ronaldo is reportedly set to feature for Al-Nassr against FC Goa in the AFC Champions League 2, raising excitement among Indian fans after his previous absence from the first-leg match in Goa.

World-class Arshdeep Singh understands why he gets dropped: India bowling coachIndia bowling coach Morne Morkel has backed left-arm pacer Arshdeep Singh, calling him a world-class bowler who understands the team's decision to experiment with different combinations ahead of the T20 World Cup next year.

The Harmanpreet Kaur-led side arrived in the national capital on Tuesday evening ahead of their interaction with the Prime Minister.

Cristiano Ronaldo included in Al-Nassr squad for FC Goa clash in Riyadh: ReportCristiano Ronaldo is reportedly set to feature for Al-Nassr against FC Goa in the AFC Champions League 2, raising excitement among Indian fans after his previous absence from the first-leg match in Goa.

World-class Arshdeep Singh understands why he gets dropped: India bowling coachIndia bowling coach Morne Morkel has backed left-arm pacer Arshdeep Singh, calling him a world-class bowler who understands the team's decision to experiment with different combinations ahead of the T20 World Cup next year.

Harmanpreet Kaur gets World Cup tattoo: Now, I will see you every morningHarmanpreet Kaur immortalises India's Women's World Cup triumph with a tattoo. The victory ends a decades-long wait and highlights the team's perseverance and leadership.

Some compared it to 1983: Sunil Gavaskar on India's seismic Women's World Cup winIndia's long-awaited Women's World Cup crown has been hailed as one of the nation's greatest cricketing triumphs. Sunil Gavaskar says the victory will shake the world order in women's cricket, inspiring a new generation to dream bigger.

Bangladesh women's cricket team captain accused of beating juniors; board deniesOut-of-favour Bangladesh pacer Jahanara Alam has levelled serious allegations against the national board and captain Nigar Sultana Joty, claiming that the current skipper "beats up" junior players in the team "a lot."

Chasing F1 dream: Mahaveer Raghunathan on journey, overcoming trolls, GT gloryOnce a figure of trolling and ridicule, Mahaveer Raghunathan has reinvented himself in the Italian GT Championship to keep his Formula One dreams alive. The Indian racer opens up on his journey, recovering from a disastrous F2 campaign and coming out on top.

ICC Cracks Down: Haris Rauf Banned, Suryakumar Fined After Heated India-Pak Asia Cup ClashesThis special report focuses on the fallout from the fiery Asia Cup clashes between India and Pakistan, with the ICC announcing sanctions against several players for breaching the Code of Conduct. The bulletin highlights that Suryakumar Yadav was accused of making 'politically charged remarks' and snubbing handshakes with Pakistan players, leading to a fine. Pakistan's Haris Rauf has been handed a two-match ban for provocative gestures during the tournament. Additionally, India's Jasprit Bumrah accepted a demerit point for his reactive gesture after dismissing Rauf. The ICC also issued an official warning to Pakistan's Sahibzada Farhan for his controversial 'gun celebration' after scoring a half-century against India during a Super 4 match in Dubai. The sanctions were announced after hearings by the ICC's Elite Panel of Match Referees following incidents in the matches on September 14, 21 and 28.

David Beckham is now Sir David Beckham: Football great knighted by King CharlesDavid Beckham has been formally knighted for his services to football and British society. The former England captain received the honour from King Charles III during a ceremony held at Windsor Castle in Berkshire on Tuesday.

Manchester United's situation is sad, Amorim cannot work wonders: RonaldoCristiano Ronaldo has delivered a brutal assessment of Manchester United's current state, saying manager Ruben Amorim cannot be expected to "work miracles" at Old Trafford and expressing sadness over the club's continued struggles.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
